name: UNION INTERNATIONALE DES AVOCATS
goal: UIA, as a global and multi‐cultural organization, facilitates professional development and international exchange of information and ideas, promotes the rule of law, defends the independence and freedom of lawyers worldwide, and emphasizes friendship, collegiality and networking among members. // OBJECTIVES // UIA’s objectives, free from all political and religious considerations, are: *	To provide benefits for members including cross‐border information and idea exchange, legal training, and development of productive personal and professional relationships. * To advance on a global basis the fundamental principles of the legal profession, including the peaceful resolution of disputes. * To promote the rule of law. * To defend lawyers' independence and freedom to practice their profession.    In furtherance of those objects, the UIA may use all appropriate means, in particular by organising events (notably scientific and training events); intervening with national and international organisations; entering into partnership agreements; editing and distributing publications; borrowing funds and creating subsidiaries.
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Competition, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Fraud prevention, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Institutional affairs, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Research and innovation, Sport, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
As a result of its activities, UIA regularly broaches issues related in particular to the respect of rights within the European Union's normative framework, the new regulations proposed by its institutions, and the decisions of the Court of Justice of the European Union. UIA also attentively follows EU’s positions regarding Rule of Law issues in EU countries, as well as following the activities of the European Union Agency for Fundamental Rights (FRA). // UIA's actions may take the form of: * Monitoring developments in European legislation in its areas of interest, in particular concerning the regulation of the legal profession, directly or indirectly (freedom of movement, fight against money laundering, fight against corruption, etc.), as well as issues related to UIA-IROL's activities (access to justice and human rights, independence of the judiciary and other Rule of Law issues, etc.) // Several of UIA's working commissions are particularly attentive to the latest regulations in their areas of expertise. That is particularly the case with the following commissions: European Union Law, Private International Law, Privacy and Digital Human Rights (e.g. Data Protection), Immigration and Nationality Law, Competition Law, Tax Law and Labour Law (see the UIA Commissions' Website http://www.uianet.org/en/commissions ). //
- Preparation, dissemination and transmission of letters, information material, discussion papers and statements of positions taken with regard to the above topics/issues. // - Advocacy regarding UIA-IROL’s main interests, in particular, protection of lawyers, independence and freedom of the legal profession and the bar associations, and other Rule of Law related issues. // - Direct contacts with members or officials of European institutions, especially to solicit their participation as speakers at UIA events.
